noun.description: The action or process of gradually reducing the strength or effectiveness of someone or something through sustained attack or pressure.
examples: the council is trying to wear down the opposition by attrition
the squadron suffered severe attrition of its bombers

noun.description: (in scholastic theology) sorrow, but not contrition, for sin.

origin: Late Middle English (in attrition (sense 2)): from late Latin attritio(n-), from atterere to rub.
